CatDescriptText: Rev. Donald L. Campbell, Epiphany Episcopal Church, Avalon, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 7, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that the Wacs and others women's units, with the exception of nurses, should be abolished in armed services during peacetime? Why?" answer reads: "I can see no reason to abolish them, that is, if they serve a purpose, and I think that they do.  Their service, which was used during war time, can well be used during peace and thus allow men to engage in other jobs."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Rev. Donald L. Campbell wearing dark overcoat, dark shirt with clerical collar, and dark hat, carrying Lutheran Book Store shopping bag, standing on Liberty Avenue with Dimlings candy store in background, Downtown
